head.title: Man Is Held After Crash Kills Woman

hedline.hl2: Man Is Held After Crash Kills Woman

block.p: A man was arrested after he ran from the scene of a fatal accident on the Cross Bronx Expressway, where his car had rear-ended a tractor-trailer, the police said yesterday.
The accident, which occurred about 9 p.m. on Friday, severely injured a woman riding in his car, who died from her injuries, according to the authorities.

A man was arrested after he ran from the scene of a fatal accident on the Cross Bronx Expressway, where his car had rear-ended a tractor-trailer, the police said yesterday.
The accident, which occurred about 9 p.m. on Friday, severely injured a woman riding in his car, who died from her injuries, according to the authorities.

The man, Glenn Salera, 29, was speeding and apparently tried to swerve into the left lane to avoid hitting the truck, which was traveling in the right lane and had slowed down in traffic approaching the Westchester Avenue exit heading west.
Mr. Salera's car, a 1992 Nissan, struck the rear left side of the truck, which is owned by a transportation company based in Memphis.
The police said Mr. Salera was driving while drunk.
He and the truck's driver, who was not identified, were uninjured, but the woman, Carmen Irizarry, 36, was taken to Jacobi Medical Center, where she died.
Ms. Irizarry, of the Morris Park section of the Bronx, was not wearing a seat belt, the police said.
